---
title: "Report for the income data"
output: html_document
---

```{r warning = F, message = F}
library(tidyverse)

income <- read.table("income.data", 
                               sep = ',', 
                               fill = F, 
                               strip.white = T) |> 
  as_tibble()

colnames(income) <- c('age', 'workclass', 'fnlwgt', 'education',
                      'education_num', 'marital_status', 'occupation',
                      'relationship', 'race', 'sex', 'capital_gain',
                      'capital_loss', 'hours_per_week', 'native_country',
                      'income')

```

## Introduction

This is R Markdown document is part of the last exercise in the course *Statistical programming with R*.  
The code chunk above has generated a datasets that you should be familiar with. Below you can see the first 6 rows of the dataset `income`:

```{r echo = F}
income |> 
  head()
```
